body_html:
*Hi* *thanks for your answer* *I tried that statement* *the output is:* name: "/device:CPU:0" 2018-11-17 17:25:27.712583: I tensorflow/core/platform/cpu_feature_guard.cc:141] Your CPU supports instructions that this TensorFlow binary was not compiled to use: AVX2 device_type: "CPU" memory_limit: 268435456 locality { } incarnation: 12899223527737949935 ] Please install GPU version of TF *But my syatem has Gpu* *what can I do?*
…
On Fri, Nov 16, 2018 at 12:00 PM Simhan Ramakrishnan < ***@***.***> wrote: Make sure you have tensorflow GPU version installed or its point to the write env which has GPU version installed You also check what devices are getting recognized . If you don't see GPU then its not the right env or TF. uninstall tensorflow and reinstall tensorflow-gpu //////////// Try this below import tensorflow as tf from tensorflow.python.client import device_lib print(device_lib.list_local_devices()) /////////// You should get something logs like below [name: "/device:CPU:0" device_type: "CPU" memory_limit: 268435456 locality { } incarnation: 17806258439xxxxxxxxx , name: "/device:GPU:0" device_type: "GPU" memory_limit: 3170530099 locality { bus_id: 1 links { } } incarnation: 141133486494xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx physical_device_desc: "device: 0, name: GeForce GTX 970, pci bus id: 0000:02:00.0, compute capability: 5.2" , name: "/device:GPU:1" device_type: "GPU" memory_limit: 3170530099 locality { bus_id: 1 links { } } incarnation: 163427xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx physical_device_desc: "device: 1, name: GeForce GTX 970, pci bus id: 0000:03:00.0, compute capability: 5.2" ] Try this too if tf.test.gpu_device_name(): print('Default GPU Device: {}'.format(tf.test.gpu_device_name())) else: print("Please install GPU version of TF") ////////////////////// output Default GPU Device: /device:GPU:0 ///////////////////////////// as n0t0ri0us mentioned please provide more details about the environment(linux,osx,windows,gpu card etc) and show some complete logs. — You are receiving this because you authored the thread. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#23773 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AqoKEn5ZIRyfCaa5G3DfYAWlM6fcuD0iks5uvneIgaJpZM4Yf3BI> .
body_text:
*Hi*
*thanks for your answer*
*I tried that statement*
*the output is:*

name: "/device:CPU:0"
2018-11-17 17:25:27.712583: I
tensorflow/core/platform/cpu_feature_guard.cc:141] Your CPU supports
instructions that this TensorFlow binary was not compiled to use: AVX2
device_type: "CPU"
memory_limit: 268435456
locality {
}
incarnation: 12899223527737949935
]
Please install GPU version of TF

*But my syatem has Gpu*
*what can I do?*
…
On Fri, Nov 16, 2018 at 12:00 PM Simhan Ramakrishnan < ***@***.***> wrote:
 Make sure you have tensorflow GPU version installed or its point to the
 write env which has GPU version installed
 You also check what devices are getting recognized . If you don't see GPU
 then its not the right env or TF. uninstall tensorflow and reinstall
 tensorflow-gpu
 //////////// Try this below
 import tensorflow as tf
 from tensorflow.python.client import device_lib
 print(device_lib.list_local_devices())
 /////////// You should get something logs like below
 [name: "/device:CPU:0"
 device_type: "CPU"
 memory_limit: 268435456
 locality {
 }
 incarnation: 17806258439xxxxxxxxx
 , name: "/device:GPU:0"
 device_type: "GPU"
 memory_limit: 3170530099
 locality {
 bus_id: 1
 links {
 }
 }
 incarnation: 141133486494xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
 physical_device_desc: "device: 0, name: GeForce GTX 970, pci bus id:
 0000:02:00.0, compute capability: 5.2"
 , name: "/device:GPU:1"
 device_type: "GPU"
 memory_limit: 3170530099
 locality {
 bus_id: 1
 links {
 }
 }
 incarnation: 163427xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
 physical_device_desc: "device: 1, name: GeForce GTX 970, pci bus id:
 0000:03:00.0, compute capability: 5.2"
 ]
 Try this too

 if tf.test.gpu_device_name():
 print('Default GPU Device: {}'.format(tf.test.gpu_device_name()))
 else:
 print("Please install GPU version of TF")
 ////////////////////// output
 Default GPU Device: /device:GPU:0
 /////////////////////////////
 as n0t0ri0us mentioned please provide more details about the
 environment(linux,osx,windows,gpu card etc) and show some complete logs.

 —
 You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
 Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
 <#23773 (comment)>,
 or mute the thread
 <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AqoKEn5ZIRyfCaa5G3DfYAWlM6fcuD0iks5uvneIgaJpZM4Yf3BI>
 .

*thanks for your answer*
*I tried that statement*
*the output is:*

2018-11-17 17:25:27.712583: I

instructions that this TensorFlow binary was not compiled to use: AVX2
device_type: "CPU"
memory_limit: 268435456
locality {
}
incarnation: 12899223527737949935
]
Please install GPU version of TF

*But my syatem has Gpu*
*what can I do?*

> Try this too
